channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-10054] Clean up ETypeConverter since Parquet supports timestamp type already
item.summary: Clean up ETypeConverter since Parquet supports timestamp type already

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Szehon Ho, can you help review this patch? Thank you!

Overall: +1 all checks pass

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12706451/HIVE-10054.patch

SUCCESS: +1 7818 tests passed

Test results: http://ec2-174-129-184-35.compute-1.amazonaws.com/jenkins/job/PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build/3112/testReport

Messages:

Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.PrepPhase

Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.ExecutionPhase

Executing org.apache.hive.ptest.execution.ReportingPhase

This message is automatically generated.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12706451 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Hi Ferdinand Xu

How is this change related to parquet timestamp support?
I see the only change was to remove ETypeConverter.

Yea, I think Ryan Blue had told me that once parquet support timestamp, we dont need to associate it with Int96 that is there in the if block, thats what this was about.

'Timestamp' type would apparently be some sort of annotation. But we need to think about backward compatibility too if we make the change, I havent had too much time to think about it.

Thanks Szehon Ho and FABIAN SERGIO RODRIGUEZ LUNA for your review.
Hi Ryan Blue, can we disassociate timestamp type with Int96 regarding to the backward compatibility?

Overall: -1 at least one tests failed

ATTACHMENT ID: 12707093 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Ferdinand Xu There is a duplicated patch for this on HIVE-10642.
We should be compatible with older files that still uses INT96 for timestamp. The patch on HIVE-10642 addresses that, and also supports the new TIMESTAMP_MILLIS.

I will set this as duplicate.
